byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Maher Samaan from Beirut, Lebanon. Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut.
byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and MAHER SAMAAN

abstract: Islamic State militants reportedly destroy several artifacts from ancient Syrian city Palmyra, including statues and 13th-century tomb; destruction underscores threat militants pose to country's heritage.
lead_paragraph: Islamic State militants said they had smashed statues from the ancient city of Palmyra in Syria, and antiquities experts said a 13th-century tomb in Iraq was wrecked.

headline.main: ISIS Destroys More Artifacts in Syria and Iraq
headline.print_headline: Islamic State Destroys More Artifacts in Iraq and Syria

snippet: Islamic State militants said they had smashed statues from the ancient city of Palmyra in Syria, and antiquities experts said a 13th-century tomb in Iraq was wrecked.
